title: DevOps Lab Prerequisites
purpose: Defines the required mindset, tools, and setup for participating in the DevOps labs.

sections.title: Mindset (Required)
points: Curiosity before comfort: break things locally, fix them, and understand why.
Every log or error is a learning signal — translate it into a prompt and insight.
Keep your environment transparent — minimal GUIs, maximum comprehension.
Learning is an exercise, not consumption. Treat each lab like a physical workout.
Speak your thoughts out loud or to AI — articulation builds understanding.

sections.title: System (Required)
points: Linux environment: Ubuntu 22.04 LTS recommended.
Windows 11 + WSL 2 + Ubuntu distro acceptable.
macOS with Docker Desktop and bash/zsh shell acceptable.
Visual Studio Code with Remote SSH or WSL extension installed.
You will open folders, run integrated terminals, and edit .json, .yaml, .sh, and .ps1 files inside VS Code.
Core CLI tools: curl, wget, git, jq, nano or vim, docker, docker compose, and kind for local Kubernetes.

sections.title: Networking / Connectivity (Required)
points: Tailscale account configured on phone, laptop, and Linux box.
Ability to SSH between connected devices.
Stable internet for package installs and AI interactions.

sections.title: Communication / Collaboration (Required)
points: Slack or Discord workspace for group chat and log sharing.
Second device (phone or tablet) used for real-time AI conversation while the terminal stays open.
Second device enables multi-voice or simulated team discussions during labs.
Second device useful for recording or screen-sharing the learning process.

sections.title: Accounts / Access (Required)
points: GitHub account for storing and versioning lab files.
Cloud provider account (Azure Free Tier, AWS Free Tier, or GCP trial) for advanced phases.
